results.title: From war to revolution
results.creator_credit: John Radcliffe and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes the development of the main opposing forces in China in the period of the civil war and disorder following the 1911 revolution, the war with Japan and the eventual establishment of the Communist regime in 1949.

results.title: From the Wet to the Top End
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bush tucker man series”.
Wild and spectacular countryside forms the backdrop for Les Hiddins’ adventures, including the rock pinnacles of a ‘Lost City’, enormous underground lava tubes and the rugged beauty of the Kimberleys. Les retells the often tragic social history of many of these remote places, such as the failed British garrison at Port Eisington. Along the way, his varied diet includes anything from Barramundi to the Tennis Ball fruit. We see how even Les gets bogged down in the wet lands of Cape York, and follow his explorations of an inland lake in an ingenious canoe made from tree bark.

results.title: From the tropics to the snow
results.creator_credit: J Lee, R. Mason, Malcolm Otton, Stanley Hawes and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A tourist film of Australia. It is not a travelogue but a story combining humour with selling and entertainment with information; highlighting the difficulties of a producer, director and script-writer in the making of a short film which is to show all the tourist attractions of Australia. The film gently (and not so gently) laughs at all those aspects of the Australian way of life that are usually included in films about Australia, and also shows some of the not so well known attractions of the country. (Awards: Gold Award, Travel Category; Australian National Travel Association’s “Jedda Award”; Kodak Silver Award for colour photography, Australian Film Awards, 1965).
results.creator_credit_for_label: J Lee, R. Mason, Malcolm Otton, Stanley Hawes and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: From the rainforests to Cape York (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ashley Smith, David Tunnell, David Leonard, Tim Clark and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Bush tucker man series”.
This video, containing the last four episodes of the series, follows Major Hiddins through the most northern rainforest in Australia at Iron Range, the northern Queensland coastline and the Gulf country, through to the west coast of Cape York where the first known sighting of Australia took place by Europeans.

results.title: From the rainforests to Cape York
results.creator_credit: Ashley Smith, David Tunnell, David Leonard, Tim Clark and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Bush tucker man series”.
The fascinating Bush Tucker Man series shows how even in remote deserts and on sandy beaches, fresh water can be found - if you know where to look for it. This video, containing the last four episodes of the series, follows Major Hiddins through the most northern rainforest in Australia at Iron Range, the northern Queensland coastline and the Gulf Country, through to the west coast of Cape York where the first known sighting of Australia took place by Europeans.

results.title: From the hut (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ron Verson, Lee Wright and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Observes the creative activities of children with logs, boards, ropes, sticks and planks as they solve, in the setting of an adventure playground, all manner of mathematical and physical problems. No narration. Filmed at Warrandyte South Primary School. Suitable for tertiary and teacher level.

results.title: From the heart of America
results.creator_credit: James Woolley, Kenneth Baldwin and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: The memorial services for the late President Eisenhower following his death in March 1969. Shows the funeral caisson moving along Constitution Avenue, the services in the Rotunda and the Washington national Cathedral and the funeral train heading west to Abilene, Kansas. Excerpts from President Nixon’s eulogy are heard.

results.title: From the heart
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Hossein Valamanesh
results.brief_description: Using 35mm footage capturing his own angiogram, Hossein Valamanesh creates a mysterious, luminescent universe which hovers, like a heartbeat, between biology and the sublime.
